actor_awards.notes: Known as 'The Great Schnozzola' for his prominent nose. He received two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (one for films, one for radio). He won a Peabody Award in 1951.

filmography.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
filmography.role_description: An escaping convict who crashes his car and, with his dying breath, tells a group of strangers about a buried fortune.
filmography.plot: A dying thief reveals the location of stolen cash to a group of strangers, sparking a chaotic cross-country race to find the loot.

filmography.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, wisecracking Hollywood comedian based on Harpo Marx who visits his injured friend.
filmography.plot: A famous radio personality breaks his hip and takes over a suburban family's home, where he is visited by his eccentric friends.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Frosty the Snowman
filmography.role_description: The storyteller who sings the title song and narrates the adventures of the living snowman.
filmography.plot: A living snowman and a little girl struggle to elude a greedy magician who is after the snowman's magic hat.

filmography.title: Billy Rose's Jumbo
filmography.role_description: The owner of the Wonder Circus who struggles to keep his show afloat amidst gambling debts and a rival takeover.
filmography.plot: A circus owner struggles to save his show from a takeover while his daughter falls for the rival's son.

filmography.title: The Great Rupert
filmography.role_description: A down-on-his-luck acrobat whose family is helped by a squirrel that drops money into their apartment.
filmography.plot: A squirrel accidentally helps a down-on-his-luck vaudeville family by dropping money into their apartment.

filmography.title: Music for Millions
filmography.role_description: The manager of a symphony orchestra who tries to help a young musician.
filmography.plot: A young girl visits her pregnant sister, a cellist in an orchestra, while they wait for news from the sister's husband in the war.

filmography.title: Two Sisters from Boston
filmography.role_description: A piano player in a Bowery beer hall who helps a Boston girl pretending to be an opera singer.
filmography.plot: A Boston girl goes to New York to find her sister, who is working in a burlesque show instead of the opera.

filmography.title: It Happened in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A high school janitor who befriends a returning GI and helps him with his musical ambitions.
filmography.plot: An ex-GI tries to become a singer in Brooklyn, aided by a janitor and a music teacher.

filmography.title: On an Island with You
filmography.role_description: An assistant director on a movie set in Hawaii who provides comic relief.
filmography.plot: A movie star goes to Hawaii and gets involved in a romantic triangle with a naval officer and her co-star.

filmography.title: The Milkman
filmography.role_description: A veteran milkman who takes the clumsy son of a rival dairy owner under his wing.
filmography.plot: The son of a dairy owner takes a job with a rival milk company and teams up with a veteran milkman.

filmography.title: This Time for Keeps
filmography.role_description: A pianist and friend to the main character in this musical romance.
filmography.plot: A soldier returns from the war and tries to resume his career as a singer against his father's wishes.

filmography.title: You're in the Army Now
filmography.role_description: A vacuum cleaner salesman who accidentally enlists in the army.
filmography.plot: Two vacuum cleaner salesmen accidentally enlist in the army and cause chaos during training.

filmography.title: Melody Ranch
filmography.role_description: The radio sidekick of a singing cowboy who helps him clean up his hometown.
filmography.plot: A radio cowboy returns to his hometown and faces real outlaws who have taken over.

filmography.title: Hollywood Party
filmography.role_description: A jungle movie star ('Schnarzan') who throws a lavish party to buy lions from a baron.
filmography.plot: A movie star throws a wild party to impress a baron and buy his lions, featuring appearances by Mickey Mouse and Laurel & Hardy.

filmography.title: Palooka
filmography.role_description: A boxing manager who discovers a naive young fighter and guides his career.
filmography.plot: A fight manager discovers a naive young boxer and guides him to the championship.

filmography.title: What! No Beer?
filmography.role_description: A barber who convinces his friend to buy a brewery in anticipation of the end of Prohibition.
filmography.plot: A barber and a taxidermist buy a brewery in anticipation of the end of Prohibition but run into trouble with the police and mobsters.

filmography.title: The Passionate Plumber
filmography.role_description: An inventor and friend to the main character in this comedy set in Paris.
filmography.plot: A plumber in Paris is hired to make a woman's lover jealous but gets involved in a duel.

filmography.title: Speak Easily
filmography.role_description: The manager of a theatrical troupe who takes advantage of a naive professor.
filmography.plot: A naive professor inherits money and gets involved with a Broadway show, thinking his bad play is a masterpiece.

filmography.title: The Phantom President
filmography.role_description: The friend and manager of a medicine show performer who impersonates a presidential candidate.
filmography.plot: A presidential candidate hires a lookalike medicine show performer to campaign for him.

filmography.title: Blondie of the Follies
filmography.role_description: A friend of the main characters who provides comic relief in this backstage drama.
filmography.plot: Two friends become showgirls and rivals for the same man in the Ziegfeld Follies.

filmography.title: Get-Rich-Quick Wallingford
filmography.role_description: A con man's sidekick who helps him swindle a small town.
filmography.plot: A con man and his sidekick arrive in a small town to swindle the locals but end up becoming legitimate businessmen.

filmography.title: The Cuban Love Song
filmography.role_description: A marine who is friends with the protagonist in this musical romance.
filmography.plot: A marine in Cuba falls in love with a peanut vendor, leading to complications with his fiancée back home.

filmography.title: Roadhouse Nights
filmography.role_description: Durante's film debut, playing a character in a story about bootlegging and romance.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigates a bootlegging ring at a roadhouse and falls for a singer.

filmography.title: Little Miss Broadway
filmography.role_description: A bandleader who helps a young orphan girl put on a show.
filmography.plot: An orphan is adopted by a hotel manager and puts on a show to save the hotel from being closed.

filmography.title: Start Cheering
filmography.role_description: The sidekick to a movie star who decides to go to college.
filmography.plot: A famous movie star quits Hollywood to go to college, followed by his manager and sidekick who try to get him kicked out.
